	-----Original Message----- 
	From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...] 
	Sent: Thu 19/08/2004 8:29 PM 
	To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
	Cc: 
	Subject: Re: [junit] TestCase inheritance...
	
	

	>> 1.      Do I need to set up FooTest to ensure that I haven't broken the
	>> contract outlined by InterfaceA or InterfaceB?
	
	> I would.

	Yeah, I tend to agree.  I wanted to make sure that I wasn't missing anything obvious that would lead me to taking a simpler approach. :)

	>> 2.      What's the best approach for setting up the tests so that I can
	>> do this, while still maximizing the value in having FooTest inherit from
	>> GenericClassBTest?
	
	> I think I outlined a good solution for this above.
	

	Yes - I think my attempts to use inner classes make the test inheritance too complex.

	>> 1.      It's difficult for me to wrap my head around how to connect the
	>> initialization of the Test Fixture in the setUp() of the inner class to
	>> a factory method which will return an instance of the class under test,
	>> say at FooTest.createGenericClassB() when that inner class is in the
	>> super class.  
	
	> I can't wrap my head around that, because I can't understand it. You and 
	> I need to pair, dude.
	

	I'm going to run with your current suggestion to see how far that takes me.  I'd hate to spend too much time on that issue if it's simply born out of the complexity in the test inheritance.  I think our discussions would lead you back to...

	> Inner classes... ewwwww.

	:)

	Thanks Joe!

	Tom
